meanings.definition: Lack of respect or seriousness in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: Her constant flippancy in class led to her getting in trouble with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: His flippancy towards his responsibilities at work eventually cost him his job.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's flippancy towards serious topics made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The flippancy of the politician's remarks on the crisis shocked the nation.
meanings.sent5: The flippancy in her tone made it clear she wasn't taking the situation seriously.

meanings.sent1: The student's flippancy towards the rules of the school resulted in multiple detentions.
meanings.sent2: His flippancy in the meeting showed a lack of regard for his colleagues' opinions.
meanings.sent3: Despite his flippancy, he managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The flippancy of the customer towards the waiter was uncalled for.
meanings.sent5: Her flippancy in the face of danger surprised everyone around her.
